arts.ttl: Semenyo: We do definitely deserve the European places
arts.sum: With this win, Bournemouth matched their record Premier League points tally of 48, which they set last season and head coach Andoni Iraola said the result came at the perfect moment with just six matches remaining. Bournemouth took the lead with just 53 seconds on the clock thanks to Semenyo ’s eighth Premier League goal of the season, as the Cherries ended a six-match winless run to climb above Fulham and go eighth.

arts.ttl: Silva annoyed by poor Fulham start and VAR verdict
arts.sum: Marco Silva admitted Fulham paid the price for a poor start against Bournemouth. A goal conceded after 52 seconds consigned Fulham to defeat on the south coast – a big blow in their pursuit of a European place. Whites boss Silva said: “I think our first 20, 25 minutes were not at the level it […] The post Silva annoyed by poor Fulham start and VAR verdict appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Silva rues ‘lack of communication’ as Ryan Sessegnon incorrectly substituted
arts.sum: With the Cottagers seeking a response to Antoine Semenyo’s first-minute goal at the Vitality Stadium, Sessegnon left the pitch.

arts.ttl: Cherries hunt for Europe is 'alive' after important win over Fulham
arts.sum: The Cherries season is ‘alive’ as they chase Europe following their 1-0 win over Fulham on Monday night, Andoni Iraola said.

arts.ttl: Iraola 'very pleased' with Bournemouth's 'key' win over Fulham
arts.sum: Bournemouth head coach Andoni Iraola says he is "very pleased" following their 1-0 win against Fulham - their first Premier League victory in almost two months.

arts.ttl: Antoine Semenyo effort enough as Bournemouth boost European push with Fulham win
arts.sum: Forward Semenyo clinically pounced on an early error from Cottagers captain Antonee Robinson to claim his 10th goal of the season.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth v Fulham team news: No Kluivert again
arts.sum: Fulham are unchanged for the Monday evening game The post Bournemouth v Fulham team news: No Kluivert again appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth v Fulham line-ups: Whites are unchanged
arts.sum: Fulham are unchanged for tonight’s match on the south coast, where a win would be a huge boost to their hopes of securing a European spot. Bournemouth: Arrizabalaga; Smith, Senesi, Huijsen, Kerkez; Cook, Adams; Semenyo, Scott, Ouattara; Evanilson. Subs: Dennis, Brooks, Tavernier, Soler, Jebbison, Araujo, Zabarnyi, Winterburn. arts.ttl: Bournemouth v Fulham: Premier League – live
arts.sum: Updates from the Vitality Stadium, kick-off 8pm BST Premier League talking points | Live league table A bit of pre-match reading Former Bournemouth manager Eddie Howe, who was taken ill last weekend, has been diagnosed with pneumonia and is likely to miss Newcastle’s games against Crystal Palace and Aston Villa this week. A huge thank you to everyone connected with Newcastle United and the wider football community for your messages and warm wishes. They have meant a lot to me and my family. I also want to pay tribute to our incredible NHS and the hospital staff who have treated me. I’m immensely grateful for the specialist care I’m receiving and, after a period of recovery, I look forward to being back as soon as possible. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: “That’s talent speaking” – Manager hails incoming Bournemouth player, explains what surprises him about him
arts.sum: On winter deadline day, AFC Bournemouth completed the signing of Eli Junior Kroupi and sent him back on loan to FC Lorient until the end of this season. Two months ago, the striker stated he wanted to finish the season at the Ligue 2 side and help them return to the top division.
